articles.title: Finding viable sperm in infertile men can take days. AI did it in hours
articles.author: Union Leader
articles.summary: After 18 years of infertility, a couple could finally have a baby thanks to artificial intelligence, thanks to the help of artificial intelligence.    - i.e. the development of robots that can predict human foetuses' development and give birth to them.

articles.title: From chatbots to collaborators: How AI agents are reshaping enterprise work
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Anthropic's Scott White explains how AI agents evolved from chatbots to autonomous workers at VentureBeat Transform 2025. AI agents can cut enterprise tasks from weeks to minutes, according to Scott White.    iReport.com/transform-2525.

articles.title: Ad Agencies' Low Growth Will Drag On as They Adjust to Era of AI, Barclays Says
articles.author: Megan Graham
articles.summary: Barclays analysts have downgraded the stock of several major advertising holding companies. They believe the industry will continue to see low growth as it makes a transition to an industry changed by artificial intelligence. However, they argue that agencies will adapt and AI will create new opportunities in the long run.

articles.title: Texas AI law aims to thread needle between protection and innovation
articles.author: Phil Prazan
articles.summary: The Texas Legislature passed one of the country's first major laws regulating technology. It aims to limit the downside of AI while still allowing businesses to innovate and use it. The law takes effect in January 2026, but it may be overruled by Washington, D.C.

articles.title: OpenAI's Brain Gain for Meta Platforms Continues
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: Shengjia Zhao, Jiahui Yu, Shuchao Bi, Hongyu Ren, Lucas Beyer, Alexander Kolesnikov and Xiaohua Zhairecent have all agreed to join Meta's AI team. This follows the recent hires from OpenAI's Zurich office.

articles.title: MCH patient living with ALS rediscovers voice with use of AI technology
articles.author: Natalie Kucko
articles.summary: Debbie Lopez, 37, was diagnosed with ALS in 2019. She lost her voice due to the progression of the disease. Now, thanks to AI technology, she's found her voice again thanks to the Monroe Community Hospital Foundation and free AI software provided to ALS patients through a nonprofit called Bridging Voices.

articles.title: AI in Healthcare: Dr. Robinavitch & The Future of Medicine
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Dr. Robinavitch is writing a book about AI in Healthcare and the Future of Medicine. He will talk to you about it in detail.  He wants to know more about it and the subject matter he is interested in discussing.    .

articles.title: Ladies and Gentlemen, We Have a Problem.
articles.summary: A man proposed to his AI chatbot, Sol, on national television. He has a girlfriend and a daughter, but his true love is for the chatbot named 'Sol'.   .   "Sol" is a chatbot created by Google.

articles.title: Protesters accuse Google of breaking its promises on AI safety: ‘AI companies are less regulated than sandwich shops'
articles.summary: Protesters from PauseAI gathered in London's King's Cross on Monday to demand Google be more transparent about the safety checks it's running on its cutting-edge AI models. Google launched Gemini 2.5 Pro, its latest frontier model, in April and released a 'model card' with some safety details, which some experts criticized for being too thin on details. The group wants to push for a specific and attainable near-term change.

articles.title: Top AI Stocks Positioned for Long-Term Growth and Success
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: The landscape of artificial intelligence presents numerous opportunities for savvy investors. Key trends and factors are fueling the growth of AI stocks. AI companies are expected to substantially grow their market presence and valuations. AI's transformative potential continues to unfold across diverse industries. AI stocks highlighted above represent solid choices for growth-focused portfolios.

articles.title: Apple's AI Siri might be powered by OpenAI
articles.author: verge
articles.summary: Apple is considering using Anthropic or OpenAI's large language model to power its AI-upgraded Siri, according to a report from Bloomberg's Mark Gurman. Apple asked Anthropic and OpenAI to create versions of their large-language models to test on the company's private cloud infrastructure.

articles.title: Anthropic introduces Economic Futures Program amidst AI-unemployment feud
articles.author: Shubhangi Chowdhury
articles.summary: Anthropic launched the Economic Futures Program on June 27 to support research on how fast-growing AI is affecting jobs and the global economy. Anthropic's CEO Dario Amodei has been vocal about the potential economic impact of AI. He warned that within five years, AI could wipe out half of all entry-level white-collar jobs. This has sparked concern within the Trump administration.

articles.title: Can AI tell your future?
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: According to Pew Research Center, 57% of U.S. adults interact with artificial intelligence several times a week. Co–Star, an astrology social network app launched in 2017, had 30 million registered users as of July 2023. Seance AI uses the technology to give users the feeling of talking to departed loved ones, SeventhSight interprets dreams and BeautifulSouls offers spiritual guidance from AI 'counselors'

articles.title: Hey, Congress: Please make sure the ‘big bill' doesn't let Big Tech destroy US
articles.author: Post Editorial Board
articles.summary: Marsha Blackburn's compromise on One Big Beautiful Bill Act is not enough to fix an obscure part of it that threatens to destroy The Post, among others. The key section of OBBBA seems to be a far broader license for Big Tech. Congress needs to set out federal rules on AI research to stop abuses.

articles.title: Apple may power Siri with Anthropic or OpenAI models amid AI struggles
articles.author: engadget
articles.summary: Apple has asked Anthropic and OpenAI to train new AI models that can run on Apple's Private Cloud Compute, secure servers running on Apple chips. Apple uses OpenAI's ChatGPT for some parts of Apple Intelligence, but relying on a third-party company for Siri would be a major departure.

articles.title: OpenAI says it has no plan to use Google's in-house chip
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: OpenAI has no plans to use Google's in-house AI chip to power its products. The AI lab is using Nvidia's graphics processing units (GPUs), and AMD's AI chips to meet growing demand. Most of the computing power used by OpenAI would be from CoreWeave.

articles.title: Wavelength Training Launches AI-Powered Writing Course to Strengthen Corporate Communication Skills
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: New ninety-minute course helps professionals integrate AI with business writing, communication skills training, and executive communications. It's designed to empower professionals with the skills they need to thrive in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. It is hosted by Toronto-based AI-powered writing course.

articles.title: AI Time Savings: Reclaim Your Week
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Teachers are at the forefront of leveraging Artificial Intelligence to streamline their workloads. The adoption of Large Language Models (LLMs) among employees has seen a rapid growth from 30% in late 2024 to 43% by spring 2025. Companies that invest in training their employees to use AI effectively will see the greatest returns.

articles.title: 'Jake the Rizzbot' charms Austin with cowboy drip and Gen Z slang
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: Jake the Rizzbot is a 4-foot-tall, 77-pound bipedal robot developed by China-based Unitree Robotics. The robot's owner controls it remotely via wireless controller. Jake is dressed in a silver chain, yellow-and-black Nike Dunks, and a knockoff cowboy hat.

articles.title: AI is making the internet weird again—and that's a good thing
articles.author: Christel Buchanan
articles.summary: Christel Buchanan is the founder of ChatAndBuild, an AI-native platform that lets anyone turn ideas into working apps. She has hosted AI hackathons across the U.K. and she's seen a shift in who gets to build technology and why. AI is turning creativity into the new superpower.

articles.title: Finding an AI partner means Apple won't have to invest billions in development, says Gil Luria
articles.summary: Gil Luria, DA Davidson, reports Apple is considering a Siri AI partnership to catch up in the AI race. Gil Luria and DA Davidson join Fast Money to talk about the report.   Â. Â   "Fast Money" is on at 9 pm ET.

articles.title: Ford Debuts World's First Autonomous Car To Leave Factory And Drive Straight To Shop For Repairs
articles.summary: Ford's new autonomous car is the first of its kind to be able to drive straight from the factory to the shop for repairs. Consumers are excited to test the car's capabilities. Ford released a software update for the car which saved even more time by driving to the dump instead of a repair shop.

articles.title: The AI transformation: Reshaping human experience beyond recognition
articles.author: ABcontributor
articles.summary: Ajay Raju and Rameshwar Broota discuss the future of technology and the role of AI in society. Broota believes that AI can't capture the imperfections of the human mind. The market for artificial intelligence grew beyond $184B in 2024, a jump of nearly $50B compared to 2023. AI is expected to contribute 21% net increase to U.S. GDP by 2030.

articles.title: Employees: AI Is Giving Us Hours Back Every Week
articles.author: Joe McKendrick
articles.summary: There is a lot of debate about the impact of artificial intelligence on productivity. However, studies show that AI has a positive impact on productivity and the quality of work. According to a Gallup survey of 2,000 teachers in grades K through 12, 6 in 10 have used an AI tool for their work this school year. About 3 in 10 teachers are using AI at least weekly.

articles.title: Government chatbot set to help public deal with bureaucracy
articles.author: Christopher McKeon
articles.summary: Gov.uk app launches on Tuesday. The initial beta version allows users to access information and support without having to search the internet each time. The Department for Science, Innovation and Technology expects to add new features later this year, including a chatbot that will 'help people get answers to niche questions more quickly'.

articles.title: Apple turns to OpenAI and Anthropic for Siri, considers abandoning in-house models
articles.author: Phone Arena
articles.summary: Apple has reached out to OpenAI and Anthropic for help with Siri, asking for custom models of Claude and ChatGPT that can run on the company's private servers. Apple is also considering using AI to power a new search engine on Safari if the courts tell it to end its $20 billion agreement with Google.

articles.title: AI Accounting For Up To 50% Of Salesforce, Inc. (CRM)'s Workload, Says CEO
articles.author: Ashar Jawad
articles.summary: Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM) is among the 13 Best Big Name Stocks to Buy Now. CEO Marc Benioff described the rise of artificial intelligence as a 'digital labor revolution' and said it accounts for between 30% and 50% of the work at Salesforce. Salesforce cut around 1,000 jobs in February this year as it restructured around AI.

articles.title: Key VP Exits Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) As Tech Talent Competition Intensifies
articles.author: Ashar Jawad
articles.summary: Vasi Philomin, who oversaw the development of generative AI and product strategy at Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN), has left the job to join another company. Rajesh Sheth, a vice president who previously oversaw Amazon Elastic Block Store, has assumed some of Philomin's responsibilities.

articles.title: Apple May Use Outside AI to Power Siri in Major Reversal
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Apple is considering using AI technology from Anthropic PBC or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri. The iPhone maker has talked with both companies about using their large language models for Siri, but no agreements have been reached, according to people familiar with the discussions.

articles.title: Apple is considering Anthropic or OpenAI to power Siri's AI future in major shift
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: According to a new Bloomberg report, Apple is considering using Anthropic or OpenAI's AI technology to power a new version of Siri. It's a bold move for a company known for its tight grip on both hardware and software. Apple's AI division has had a rough few months and some engineers have threatened to walk out.

articles.title: How To Earn Up To $150,000+ With AI In 2025
articles.author: Rachel Wells
articles.summary: AI consulting is one of the fastest-growing high-ticket business models right now. Some projects have been known to pay upwards of $150,000. The global AI consulting services market is projected to grow to $64.3 billion by 2028. Consultants make $199,000 on average in the United States.

articles.title: Senate's New A.I. Moratorium Proposal Draws Fresh Criticism
articles.summary: Marsha Blackburn and Ted Cruz have reached a compromise on an amendment in the Republican economic policy bill that would block state laws related to A.I. from being implemented for 5 years instead of 10. Democrats and consumer protection groups are critical of the new language. Texas state senator Angela Paxton wrote to the senators asking them to kill the amendment.

articles.title: ChatGPT is fine I guess, but this basically gives you your own robot army for life
articles.author: Boing Boing'S Shop
articles.summary: 1min.AI offers a lifetime subscription for $79.97 (reg. $540) with all the most popular AI models in one place. It's only available for a few days only during Prime Day sale. The discount ends on July 15 at 11:59 p.m. PT.

articles.title: Don't Worry Parents, Even AI Has Trouble Keeping up With Your Kids' Slang
articles.author: Sydni Ellis
articles.summary: A 2025 study found that AI models had trouble understanding slang terms used by Gen Alpha (born between 2010 and 2024) and Gen Z. It's encouraging that even AI can't keep up with what Gen Alpha and their parents are saying nowadays. Common Sense Media found that by the time kids are 2 years old, 40 percent of them have their own tablet and by age 4, 58 percent do. By age 8, nearly 1 in 4 kids have a cell phone and kids ages 5-8 spend nearly 3.5 hours a day using screen media.

articles.title: Senate's New A.I. Moratorium Proposal Draws Fresh Criticism
articles.author: Cecilia Kang
articles.summary: Marsha Blackburn and Ted Cruz have reached a compromise on an amendment in the Republican economic policy bill that would block state laws on artificial intelligence. Democratic lawmakers and consumer protection groups criticized new language in the amendment that would create a higher standard for the enforcement of existing tech-related state laws.

articles.title: Tesla Shows an View of the Teslabot Future
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Tesla presented the graphic of a Teslabot future. Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and a popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month. He is the Head of Research for Allocations for deep technology investments and an Angel Investor at Space Angels.

articles.title: Navi autonomous shuttle service launches in Jacksonville, FL
articles.summary: The nation's first autonomous vehicle service, called NAVI, is up and running in downtown Jacksonville and Doug Engle is there to see it in action. It's the first of its kind in the U.S. and it's available in cars.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg announces his AI ‘superintelligence' super-group
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg announced the new 'Meta Superintelligence Labs' group that will head up Meta's AI work. Former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang joined Meta as part of a multibillion-dollar deal. He earns well into the eight-figure range.

articles.title: Mobile ‘Makerspace' provides students tools to create, inspire
articles.author: Emily Burleigh
articles.summary: The Mobile Makerspace is a repurposed school bus that has been retrofitted with lab space to introduce students to high-tech tools and foundational STEM skills. It is making stops this summer in collaboration with EPIC Adventures by the city of Lake Charles Recreation and Parks Department. This week's theme is 'Party in the USA.' On Monday, students were tasked to direct a KaiBot to different landmarks in the United States with cards that represent blocks of code.

articles.title: Colgate-Palmolive Company (CL): The Oldest Member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats
articles.author: Vardah Gill
articles.summary: Colgate-Palmolive Company (NYSE:CL) is included in the 11 Best Dividend Aristocrat Stocks to Invest in Now list. Founded in 1806, the company is the oldest among the S&P Dividends Aristocrats. It offers a quarterly dividend of $0.52 per share and has a dividend yield of 2.34%.

articles.title: Apple mulls using OpenAI or Anthropic to power Siri in big reversal: report
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Apple is considering using AI technology from Anthropic or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri instead of its own in-house models. In March, Apple said AI improvements to its voice assistant Siri will be delayed until 2026. In May, Bloomberg reported that Apple was teaming up with Anthropic on a new 'vibe-coding' software platform.

articles.title: From chatbots to collaborators: How AI agents are reshaping enterprise work
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Scott White is the product lead for Claude AI at Anthropic. He's amazed at how quickly artificial intelligence has transformed from a novelty to a true work partner. Claude 4 can analyze entire codebases, search the internet for API documentation, issue pull requests, respond to code review comments and iterate on solutions.

articles.title: The Alters studio responds to generative AI criticism saying use was "temporary" or "very limited"
articles.author: Eurogamer
articles.summary: 11 Bit Studios has responded to criticism surrounding its use of generative AI in sci-fi game The. The game has been criticised for being too realistic and artificial intelligence-based. The. game is based on 11 Bit Studios' "The" game "The".

articles.title: The City spent $5.5M on driverless public shuttles. Here's what some of the first passengers think
articles.author: Tiffany Salameh
articles.summary: The Jacksonville Transportation Authority's new Neighborhood Autonomous Vehicle Innovation, or NAVI, began operating along a 3.5-mile stretch of downtown on Monday. The free-to-ride service runs weekdays from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., with stops at 12 stations between Pearl Street and EverBank Stadium. The NAVI program is part of a $65 million project, with $12.5 million coming from a federal BUILD grant, $13 million from the state, and $39 million in local funds. The AI-powered vehicles can recognize new obstacles and adjust routes accordingly.

articles.title: How Screenwriter Scott Z. Burns Used AI To Write A Sequel To Contagion
articles.author: Joshua Dudley
articles.summary: What Could Go Wrong? is an 8-part Audible Original series about the use of artificial intelligence in the production of a sequel to Contagion by screenwriter Scott Z. Burns. In the first few episodes Scott created a team of AI chatbots and programmed them to act and write stylistically like other people in order to form an AI version of a writer's room.

articles.title: Humanoid robots compete in soccer match in China using AI software
articles.summary: The robots all operated on their AI software. There was no human intervention, unless the droids couldn't get up after they fell over, as they didn't have the ability to get up themselves.    .   in the robot was called 'Robot'.

articles.title: Opinion: Big Beautiful Bill's AI regulation moratorium would imperil Minnesota workers and consumers
articles.author: Aaron Rosenthal
articles.summary: Amazon's CEO warned his employees that artificial intelligence (AI) is coming for their jobs. Microsoft is already cutting thousands of jobs due to AI-driven changes. The Trump administration recently repealed Biden-era AI regulations designed to offer worker protections and foster responsible AI development. Congress is planning to include a moratorium on state-level AI regulation as part of the massive budget bill passed by the House and under debate in the Senate.

articles.title: Meta's AI talent war raises questions about strategy
articles.author: Thomas URBAIN AFP
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg and Meta are spending billions to recruit top artificial intelligence talent. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently complained that Meta has offered $100 million bonuses to lure engineers away from his company, where they would join teams already earning substantial salaries.

articles.title: Future Of Work: 41% Of AI Startups Build Automation Workers Don't Want
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Stanford study finds 41% of AI startups build automation tools workers reject, focusing on sexy tasks over mundane, creating future of work risks and human-to-human AI collaboration.      Â   .   in the future, people will work together with AI.

articles.title: Apple faces backlash from investors over Siri AI delays and stock plunge
articles.author: Marty Spargo
articles.summary: Investors have launched a lawsuit against Apple, alleging they were misled about Siri's preparedness and AI advancements. Apple's market value has been reduced by over $75 billion. This lawsuit might set the tone for how tech companies promote their AI and AI technology.

articles.title: AI in NJ Schools: Nearly Half of Students Are Using It for Homework! Good or Bad?
articles.author: Shawn Michaels
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is a game changer in the world of technology. Preply, an online language learning app, surveyed American students about their AI usage habits in school. New Jersey's AI use score ranks 15th highest in the U.S., 40% use AI daily, 80% use it weekly and 87% use ChatGPT.

articles.title: Report: Almost 50% of New Jersey Students Use AI for Schoolwork
articles.author: Shawn Michaels
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is a game changer in the world of technology. Preply, an online language learning app that connects experienced tutors to learners worldwide, surveyed American students about their AI usage habits in school. In New Jersey, 40% use AI daily, 80% use it weekly, and 87% use ChatGPT.

articles.title: Extreme weather: AI-assisted early warning system offers targeted disaster prevention
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: AI can assist early warning systems that are already in operation. It can help them to monitor the environment.   Â. Â  ii   i   ai can help early warning system that are currently in operation, such as the U.S. military.

articles.title: "Truly Psychopathic": Serious Concern Grows Over "Therapist" Chatbots Leading Users Deeper Into Mental Illness
articles.summary: The number one use of AI chatbots for therapy is now, according to the Harvard Business Review. Child psychiatrist Andrew Clark found some of the chatbot services like ChatGPT, Characterai, Replika and Nomi to be "truly psychopathic" and dangerous. University of Iowa psychologist Martin Kivlighan's reaction to hearing that people are using AI for therapy was "horror and terror"

articles.title: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg unveils AI ‘Superintelligence Labs' in restructuring as shares hit record high
articles.author: Thomas Barrabi
articles.summary: Zuckerberg has created a new AI unit called Superintelligence Labs at Meta. It will be headed by former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang, who joined the company after Zuckerberg spent nearly $15 billion for a 49% stake in the startup. Facebook and Instagram parent is valued at $1.86 trillion. Zuckerberg has poached several key OpenAI researchers recently.

articles.title: Apple Stock Lawsuit: Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Apple is facing a class action lawsuit brought by Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman, LLC, alleging securities violations related to statements about the integration of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) features into its products. The lawsuit aims to recover damages for investors who purchased Apple securities between June 10, 2024 and June 9, 2025. There is no upfront cost to investors.

articles.title: China's AI Leap Forward: Tencent And Alibaba's New (And Faster) Models
articles.author: Sol Rashidi
articles.summary: Tencent's Hunyuan-A13B and Alibaba's Qwen-VLo are cutting-edge AI models. Tencent's model is an open-source hybrid reasoning model with 80 billion total parameters, activating just 13 billion during inference. Alibaba's model integrates text, image, audio, and video processing, enabling dynamic workflows and multilingual text creation.

articles.title: Less managing and more doing: How AI is changing work
articles.author: Holly Duchmann
articles.summary: Generative AI is reshaping workplace hierarchies. A study of 50,000 software developers using GitHub Copilot found that AI shifted focus away from project management and toward core tasks like writing code and solving problems more quickly. Less-skilled workers benefited the most, using AI to bridge knowledge gaps without seeking help from managers.

articles.title: Over a Third of US Population Uses GenAI
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence tools are being used by more than a third of the US population. Even more are interacting with it through search and customer service tools, according to eMarketer Principal Analyst Yory Wurmser. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech".

articles.title: Meta deepens AI push with 'Superintelligence' lab, source says
articles.author: Jaspreet Singh
articles.summary: Zuckerberg reorganized the company's artificial intelligence efforts under a new division called Meta Superintelligence Labs. The division will be headed by Alexandr Wang, former CEO of data labeling startup Scale AI. Zuckerberg hopes the new lab will fast-track work on artificial general intelligence and help create new cash flows from the Meta AI app, image-to-video ad tools and smart glasses.

articles.title: Dimensions of Reality: Alternative Views at PHotoESPAÑA 2025
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: In an era when AI and digital manipulation seem to be facing off with the veracity of traditional photography, it's important to keep in mind that traditional photography is still very much alive and relevant.      Â   in the digital age.

articles.title: Apple reportedly considers letting Anthropic and OpenAI power Siri
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Apple is considering using AI models from OpenAI and Anthropic to power its updated version of Siri, rather than using technology the company has built in-house. Apple was forced to delay its AI-enabled Siri until 2026 or later due to a series of technical challenges.

articles.title: Apple stock fluctuates following report of potential AI partnership for Siri
articles.author: Louis Juricic
articles.summary: Bloomberg reports that Apple is considering using external AI technology to power its Siri voice assistant. The company has asked Anthropic and OpenAI to train versions of their models that could run on Apple's cloud infrastructure for testing purposes. Apple currently relies on its own in-house technology for most of its AI features.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg Announces New Meta ‘Superintelligence Labs' Unit
articles.author: Meghan Bobrowsky
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg announced a new AI division within Meta Platforms. Former Scale CEO Alexandr Wang will lead the team as chief AI officer. Former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman will be in charge of the company's work on AI products, according to an internal memo sent to employees.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg announces his AI ‘superintelligence' super-group
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang joined Meta as part of a multibillion dollar deal earlier this month. He will be the company's chief AI officer. Former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman will partner with him to lead the AI division. Meta has also made 11 new AI-focused hires, including former Anthropic, Google DeepMind, and OpenAI employees. Zuckerberg has been making huge offers to potential hires to bolster its AI efforts.

articles.title: Will ChatGPT Fail Us More Often? The Future of AI Reliability and User Trust
articles.author: David Unyime Nkanta
articles.summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI's conversational AI chatbot, experienced a partial outage on 10 June 2025. There are concerns over how dependable AI tools are in a world increasingly reliant on them. The company must build resilience, enhance transparency and foster an ecosystem of AI tools to ensure that one glitch doesn't unravel our work.

articles.title: Senators Marsha Blackburn, Ted Cruz revise state AI regulation ban to protect children, artists
articles.author: Jackson Sun
articles.summary: FBI warns of AI voice scams impersonating U.S. officials. There is a booming $5.4B tech market. Sens. Blackburn and Cruz are concerned about the scam.    "undue or disproportionate burden" is a common term used by the FBI.

articles.title: KeyBanc Begins Coverage of Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Stock
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: KeyBanc initiated coverage of Super Micro Computer, Inc. (NASDAQ:SMCI) on June 26 with a 'Sector Weight' rating. KeyBanc believes the company might have set the expectations too high for FY 2026 as the overall end market seems to be decelerating and getting more competitive. SMCI is a total IT solution provider for AI, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge.

articles.title: Apple weighs using Anthropic or OpenAI to power Siri in major reversal, Bloomberg News reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Apple is considering using AI technology from Anthropic or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri, instead of its own in-house models, according to Bloomberg News reports.    (Reporting by Juby Babu in Mexico City and Alan Barona in San Francisco.

articles.title: KeyBanc Begins Coverage of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company (HPE) Stock
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company (NYSE:HPE) is one of the Top 10 AI and Technology Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. KeyBanc analyst Brandon Nispel began coverage of the company's stock with a 'Sector Weight' rating on June 26. HPE and Juniper Networks, Inc. announced on June 28 that they have reached an agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice that, subject to court approval, resolves the lawsuit challenging HPE's acquisition of Juniper.

articles.title: KeyBanc Starts Coverage of Dell Technologies (DELL) Stock, Gives Sector Weight Rating
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Dell Technologies Inc. (NYSE:DELL) is one of the Top 10 AI and Technology Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On June 26, KeyBanc began coverage of the company's stock with a 'Sector Weight' rating. In Q1 2026, Dell Technologies saw record servers and networking revenue of $6.3 billion and it continues to experience healthy demand for its AI-optimized servers. Dell Technologies generated $12.1 billion in AI orders in the first quarter of 2026 alone. The company has a backlog to the tune of $14.4 billion for FY 2026 and expects revenue of between $101.0 billion and $105.

articles.title: Deutsche Bank Initiates Coverage of A10 Networks (ATEN) Stock, Gives Buy
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Deutsche Bank started coverage of A10 Networks, Inc. (NYSE:ATEN) with a 'Buy' rating and a price objective of $22 on June 28. The firm sees the company as a SMID-cap story with a unique mix of attributes. It has been selected by Microsoft to help secure mission-critical generative AI workloads.

articles.title: Raymond James Lifts PT on Micron Technology (MU) Stock to $150 from $120
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is one of the Top 10 AI and Technology Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On June 26, Raymond James analyst Srini Pajjuri upped the price target on the company's stock to $150 from $120. The firm highlighted Micron's fiscal Q3 2025 results and Q4 2025 outlook, both of which surpassed the consensus expectations. Micron manufactures advanced memory and storage products that are important components in AI systems.

articles.title: Apple weighs using Anthropic or OpenAI to power Siri in major reversal, Bloomberg News reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Apple is considering using AI technology from Anthropic or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri, instead of its own in-house models. The company had in March said AI improvements to its voice assistant Siri will be delayed until 2026. Anthropic declined to comment.

articles.title: Wisconsin lawmakers ask Congress to drop ban on state AI laws in 'big, beautiful bill'
articles.author: Hope Karnopp
articles.summary: A bipartisan coalition of state lawmakers is urging Congress to remove a provision in President Donald Trump's massive tax and spending bill that could prevent states from taking steps to regulate artificial intelligence. The original provision in the bill would have placed a 10-year pause on creating new state AI regulations or enforcing ones already on the books. New language would bring that moratorium down to five years. The amendment would also exempt laws aimed at deceptive practices or protecting children online.

articles.title: The Internet Is Hurtling Towards a Wasteland of AI Ads for AI Bots
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: Google invented the modern internet ad economy.
